column4: hello i'm making a GTK application that embeds a xulrunner-based HTML component. After upgrading to 9.10, I get this error when linking: /usr/bin/ld: warning: libmozjs.so, needed by /usr/lib/xulrunner-devel-1.9.1.4/lib/libxul.so, not found (try using -rpath or -rpath-link)
but libmozjs.so is available as locate tells me
you will need to find where xulrunner expects the file to be then symlink it
or check the location of the file is part of PATH
ah, /usr/lib/xulrunner/libmozjs.so is dead. But why do I have to set it manually?
not sure, its not something i use
but you obviously do in your situation
the files in the packages will go right where they are now so i doubt it will remedy stuff, worth a try now. It is free

I managed to set the link to the missing libmozjs.so manually. Now the linker succeeds. But the built binary complains: libxul.so: cannot open shared object file: No such file or directory. This seems related to https://bugs.launchpad.net/ubuntu/+source/xulrunner-1.9/+bug/286906
i guess you'll have to work around the bug or fix the bug yourself
its still essentially linux which has lots of weird quirks
well, any political policy isnt the best but the best we have ;)
if you can mount it then it is partitioned
if you use sudo fdisk diskname     (not the partition), e.g.   sudo fdisk /dev/sdb     then you can delete the partition there (make sure the partition is unmounted before you run the command)
My question is: Why do the partitions not appear in GParted? (Another Disk (sda) is shown correctly. fdisk -l shows the partitions of sdb correctly. But not GParted ..
not sure man, as rusty says, make sure you change the disk in gparted
